dublinCore.dc:title: 114 S816 IS: To amend the Coquille Restoration Act to clarify certain provisions relating to the management of the Coquille Forest.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Wyden (for himself and Mr. Merkley) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Coquille Restoration Act to clarify certain provisions relating to the management of the Coquille Forest.

section.text: Section 5(d) of the Coquille Restoration Act (25 U.S.C. 715c(d)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by striking paragraph (5) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: Subject to subparagraph (B), the Secretary, acting through the Assistant Secretary for Indian Affairs, shall manage the Coquille Forest in accordance with the laws pertaining to the management of Indian trust land.

clause.text: Unprocessed logs harvested from the Coquille Forest shall be subject to the same Federal statutory restrictions on export to foreign nations that apply to unprocessed logs harvested from Federal land.

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, all sales of timber from land subject to this subsection shall be advertised, offered, and awarded according to competitive bidding practices, with sales being awarded to the highest responsible bidder.

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (10) through (12) as paragraphs (9) through (11), respectively.
